questions.question: Which of the following best describes Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
options: a) A field that only focuses on controlling robots
b) A part of computer science that creates machines that simulate human intelligence
c) A method to speed up internet connectivity
d) A tool for creating websites

questions.question: AI simulates __________ such as reasoning, learning, perception, and speech.
Which of the following best describes data collection in AI systems?
options: a) Applying rules to reach conclusions
b) Gathering input from users or sensors
c) Drawing conclusions based on emotions
d) Training a system with expert advice

questions.question: The component of an AI system that applies logic to draw new conclusions from known information is called __________.
Rules in AI systems are used to guide decisions by applying predefined logic.
In supervised learning, the system is trained using __________ data.
Clustering is a method used in supervised learning to classify data based on labels.
questions.answer: False. Clustering is part of unsupervised learning.

questions.question: The part of an expert system that allows communication between the user and the system is called the __________.

Match each expert system component with its description:
A. Knowledge base
B. Rules base
C. Inference engine
An expert system that mimics human knowledge to offer advice or solve problems is known as an __________.

Match each type of AI with its description:
A) Narrow AI
B) General AI
C) Strong AI
D) Simulated intelligence
Collaborative filtering recommends products by comparing a userâ€™s preferences with similar users.
Expert systems can provide biased decisions because they rely on human input.
questions.answer: False. They offer unbiased decisions based purely on logic.
